projectPurpose: To provide the open-source bootloader and firmware that runs on the BitBox02 hardware wallet device, enabling secure offline storage of cryptocurrency private keys and safe transaction management.
mainFeatures: Securely store private keys offline
Sign cryptocurrency transactions
Generate and manage recovery seeds (BIP39) with microSD card backup/restore
Interactive user interface via touch sensors and OLED display for transaction verification
Support for key derivation (BIP32/BIP39)

alternatives.name: Trezor Firmware
alternatives.license: GNU Lesser General Public License v3 (LGPLv3)
mainFeatures: Secure offline key storage
Transaction signing
Supports multiple cryptocurrencies (depending on device model/firmware)
PIN and passphrase protection
Integration with Trezor Suite desktop/web application

alternatives.name: Coldcard Firmware
mainFeatures: Bitcoin-only focus (optional)
True air-gap support using PSBT and MicroSD card
Secure element for key storage
Physical keypad for PIN entry
Duress PIN and Brick Me PIN features

alternatives.name: Ledger Firmware
alternatives.license: Partially Open Source / Proprietary (Core firmware is largely proprietary)
mainFeatures: Secure element chip for key storage
Supports a wide range of cryptocurrencies and tokens
Integration with Ledger Live application (desktop and mobile)
Staking and NFT management support (depending on device model)
Physical transaction confirmation

marketPositioning: The BitBox02, powered by its open-source firmware, is positioned as a secure and user-friendly Swiss-made hardware wallet. It differentiates itself through its dual-chip security architecture, intuitive touch sensor interface, microSD card backup functionality, and the option of a dedicated Bitcoin-only firmware for enhanced security and reduced attack surface. While competing with established players like Ledger (known for broad altcoin support and large ecosystem) and Trezor (a long-standing open-source advocate), BitBox02 carves out a niche emphasizing a balance of strong open-source security, hardware features, and ease of use, particularly appealing to users who value Swiss quality and a focused, transparent approach to hardware wallet security.
